column4: heyhey... trying to get the webGUI working on my crunchbang box and I keep getting a 403 error. any thoughts?
crunch bang is not even based on ubuntu any more last i checked..
and in any case its not an 'offically supported here' ubuntu variant - even if it was still based on ubuntu.
install was exactly like the Ubuntu install
check crunchbang homepage. Im pretty suire they switched to  Debian
could be you are on an older version.
maybe... any idea why transmission might do that tho? I did just install apache, think that has something to do with it?
as far as i know those apps dont  require apache to have a web interface.. im using the latest 'transmission 2.00' version from a PPA also.. so its hard to telll
yeah...I was trying to get fluxtorrent-b4rt to work and I got tired of looking at outdated tutorials and decided i was going to revert to tried and true transmission. now it's not working :(
and #! ships with rtorrent which is good... if i could remember how to use it.
takes me all of 20 sec to install rtorrent on ubuntu.. i dont see much need for #! basically
i liked how it felt like Ubuntu and the small resource hunger
do you have any suggestions for a small distro i could use instead that is easy to set up SMB ?
samba is rather easy to set up on most any disrto.
for small 'footprint' theres xubuntu and lubuntu .
would you believe that i tried both of those and didn't like them much. but it might be because i tried 9.04... should i try an earlier one?
